title: Kin going to get nerfed.
body:
The Passive maybe just a little to strong if you get rolling quickly. Q is fine. W is the real problem, way too much damage. Far too easy to roll face across keyboard and get a kill but of course, knocking and keeping Kin out of their W/R zones will mess them up good as her range is short.

All that said she's quite fun.

I love the fact when she was delayed it was because of a bug that caused Wolf to disappear and I commented that he got shot and went AWOL and that's almost how Wolf's /joke dialogue plays out XD

replies.body: Lets face it riot will release a champ op and then nerf it they have sed they do this on prepose I got told I was a fool as I sed that kindred was and is op as I have a pbe account a 60 min kindred is so op iv had a game with it that went for 1:13 min I had 31% hp damage on my passive not bs at all.

I absolutely love kindred, my new favorite jungler, but I do admit they are a little too strong, a good argument can't be made for either side of the passive, 1. It is very strong if you get stacks early and accompanied with Botrk you can do crazy % damage, but 2. You have to remember that unlike other adc's you don't build straight ad/crit so your normal AA's do less than normal for a ranged AD Anyway so it almost evens out.
What I think is stupidly strong is her heal, it's fine for jungling but it's crazy sustain if you take her in a lane.

I don't find the w very strong but the e definitely needs to be nerfed that slow and damage is outrageous, I'm not convinced the passive needs to be nerfed coz you do need to put in a decent amount of effort to get those stacks up
Yeah I suppose the stacks stemming from 15 or so marked kills is gonna hurt like a bitch anyway.
They are way too squishy to get nerfed because of damage. If they are to nerf kin then they would have to re-balance the character, so that it isn't complete garbage

She's certainly not as strong as some others but I agree she'll probably get hit with a nerf, likely only a smallish one though to her W or E or possibly the Q cooldown in W though I'd consider that unlikely. Her passive is normally pretty hard to stack past 10 or 12 in a normal game but it depends how successful you are ofc. I would consider her maybe a bit too strong but not necessarily OP, I think the word is more than a little overused though I'd agree on things like Darius heal (which I think just got nerfed?) or Veigar ult though Veigar has to snowball a lot harder than Darius.

Theoretically they introduce champs a bit stronger than they think they should be to account for the learning curve, and they usually get their first balance in the next patch, but I honestly think once people learn to play against her she'll be in a pretty good spot.

tl;dr she'll most likely get a small nerf but nothing huge.
